meanings.definition: To pull or draw along after itself or oneself
meanings.sent1: The strong wind entrains the leaves, making them dance in the air.
meanings.sent2: The train entrains the carriages behind it as it moves along the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy entrains the other dogs to follow its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter entrains everyone around her to smile and join in the joy.
meanings.sent5: The magnetic force of the giant magnet entrains the metal objects towards it.

meanings.definition: To incorporate into a group or system
meanings.sent1: The new student quickly entrains into the class and makes friends.
meanings.sent2: The manager entrains the new ideas into the existing project for improvement.
meanings.sent3: The chef entrains the unique flavors into the dish, creating a delicious blend.
meanings.sent4: The artist entrains different styles into their artwork, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The teacher entrains the students' interests into the lesson, making it engaging.

meanings.definition: To synchronize with a rhythm or pattern
meanings.sent1: The dancers entrain their movements to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent2: The heartbeats of the runners entrain as they pace themselves during the race.
meanings.sent3: The pendulum clock entrains with the ticking of the wall clock in a rhythmic harmony.
meanings.sent4: The birds entrain their chirping with the sounds of nature around them.
meanings.sent5: The drummers entrain their drumming to create a unified rhythm during the performance.
